div.head: Lettering of gold on paper
div.ab: Write with milk of the fig tree then let it dry a little, next lay the goldleaf, & once quite dry, rub with a linen cloth and only the lettering will remain.

div.head: For bursting grenades and giving force to fireworks
div.ab: Put among the powder six times as much of quicksilver and one sixth part of quicksilver.

div.head: Tempering for balls for piercing armor of proof
div.ab: Heat the lead ball as much as you can without melting it, and when it will be very hot, temper it in the strongest vinegar that you can. And do this four or five times. Next, chop some lard very finely & some cloth also very finely, mix all together & use it as wadding, and by a little force & very precisely, make it to go into the arquebus or pistol. And before shooting, cha, if possible, make it so that the ball is hot.

div.head: For making a breach in a wall by night
div.ab: Having made a hole in the wall as you know, put a mortar inside, charged with powder, which should be as if lying down & the other upright, then plug the hole & give fire.
